text.KPI name and description:
Quality of products
   Products are delivered following relevant IDS quality assurance and signed off by FCDO SRO. Four criteria:
   1) BASIC Research has submitted evidence of responses to:
   a. 2 internal reviews of products (at least 1 reviewer with 10+ years experience)
   b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)
   Product then submitted to FCDO as part of quarterly report usually on the final day of the quarter. 
   Steps 2, 3 and 4 to occur after that deadline.
   2) BASIC Research has responded to FCDO reviews
   3) FCDO deems the product to be within the agreed* scope in terms of planned purpose and content
   4) FCDO signs off the product
text.Good target: When FCDO signs off the product the full amount of funds linked to that product will be released.

text.Contract title and description: Transparency and Accountability to Improve Economic Development and Service Delivery (Traction) — Ma
text.KPI name and description:
Palladium responds to 100% of FCDO priorities demonstrated through the quarterly progress report which is submitted not later than 15 days after the end of each quarter. Regular communication on progress of activities through 100% bi-weekly catch-up meetings and other forums. Team changes are communicated with FCDO before they are made and any change in key personnel is not implemented before agreeing with FCDO. This will also include Palladium's responsiveness to FCDO's request to change personnel demonstrated through quarterly progress reports which are submitted not later than the 15th of the following month of the reporting period.
   >2 weeks/ No meetings: Does not research or provide feedback to any FCDO priorities within 2 weeks of receiving the request.  Some actions or requests falling through cracks. No system in place to track FCDO requests and priorities. Meetings being cancelled or not attended.	 
   >2 weeks/ Delays: Takes more than 2 weeks to research and provide feedback to FCDO requests with several follow ups. Quality of responses not up to standard. No system in place to track FCDO requests. Meetings scheduled but delayed and most of them not attended by responsible officers	
   Within 2 weeks/ Needed remedial actions: Research and feedback provided within 2 weeks of receiving the request. Remedial actions needed on the responses or communication products. A robust system is in place to track FCDO requests. Meetings scheduled in time with full attendance.	
   Within 2 weeks / no remedial actions: Research and feedback provided within 2 weeks of receiving the request. Responses/communication product submitted with high quality with no remedial actions. A good system is in place to track FCDO requests. Meetings scheduled in time with full attendance of responsible officers.

text.Contract title and description: Future Defence Infrastructure Services (FDIS) - Hard FM Built Estate - South West Region
text.KPI name and description: Statutory and Mandatory Compliance
text.Comments: Plans have progressed since this reporting period and we are confident that this measure will show improvement.  We have developed and shared our Social Value Strategy, Site plans are in place, we are working with Defence  Infrastructure Organisation (DIO) on the Integrated rural management plans and have begun pilots on SMART sites and other net zero projects in line with budget holder requirements.  During the Quarter there were five complaints that weren’t resolved within seven days. The delays were due to issues with parts supply or the actual time to complete the task. The end user was contacted with a resolution plan but wouldn’t close the complaint until the original task was complete. As this was early in the contract we have implemented an improvement plan which has resulted in all complaints received in August were within KPI

text.KPI name and description: % of starters within the period must be placed at or below rate card
text.Comments:
Poor performance has occurred due to a microset of data of 3 workers for the month of June and no new starters in the month of May, which means that KPIs will be distorted as a result and move up and down from one month to the other given the low numbers. 
One rate provided by the Hiring Manager which was above the rate set out on the rate card was in order to secure the right candidate for a very short assignment and the other was a selected candidate referred by the Hiring Manager. 
This is mostly driven by shifting market rates which are outside of the supplier's control, however the rate card for one of the requirements has since changed and is now better aligned with current market conditions.

   • 6 = 100% Outstanding delivery with innovation and outstanding execution, well exceeding contractual requirements.
   • 5 = 83% Proactive supplier delivering efficiently and effectively above contractual expectations.
   • 4 = 66% Supplier delivering efficiently and effectively. Very few or no improvements needed.

text.Contract title and description: Tackling Deadly Diseases in Africa Programme (TDDAP)
text.KPI name and description:
Quality of narrative reporting
   
   This indicator assesses the quality of the quarterly narrative programme report to DFID, based on the specified criteria:
   1.  Reports are submitted by the agreed deadline and in the correct template                                                                                                                               
   2. Report answers the key 'exam questions' without superfluous or duplicative content ; reports are well-structured in a logical and coherent order, written in "one voice", with effective use of headings and sub-headings no longer than 40 pages for main body of report                                                                                                 
   3. Conclusions are supported by data, high-level analysis and evidence as can be expected in a concise report                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
   4. Use of plain English with very few spelling and grammatical errors, avoidance of jargon and no use of acronyms without written in full when first used                                                                                                                         
   5. Effective use of diagrams, graphs and tables to illustrate
   6. Response to feedback on written deliverables is submitted on time: usually 2 weeks for quarterly reporting and 1 week for other products, unless otherwise agreed and as recorded in the deliverable tracker.

text.Contract title and description: Stabilisation and Enabling Works at Grenfell Tower
text.KPI name and description:
Quality Assurance of Structural Works - Meet the five measures of inspection, defect identification and resolution. These are:1 Quality Assurance procedure maintained updated and available for audit weekly 
2 The Supplier to carryout engineers inspection of works, sign-off each month and share the report with MHCLG
3 Zero new defects identified within period.
4 All critical defects to be resolved within 24 hours and all non-critical defects corrected in 10 days from point of identification. 
5 All props throughout the tower to be checked twice weekly
